variant.name: ClamshellLauncher
variant.summary: app launcher in clamshell mode

variant.name: DiagnosticsUi
variant.summary: CROS Diagnostics Application

variant.name: FakeKeyboardHeuristic
variant.summary: Fake Keyboard Heuristic

variant.name: FastPair
variant.summary: Fast Pair

variant.name: LockOnSuspend
variant.summary: lock screen on device suspend

variant.name: NearbyShare
variant.summary: Nearby Share

variant.name: NearbyShareBackgroundScanning
variant.summary: Background scanning for Nearby Share to detect and notify the user of devices nearby that are attempting to share

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicActivations
variant.summary: Turning on number pad mode for a dynamic numberpad.

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicCancellations
variant.summary: Turning off number pad mode for a dynamic numberpad, without having used a number-pad key.

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing enter on dynamic number pad.

variant.name: NumberpadDynamicNonEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing key other than enter on dynamic number pad.

variant.name: NumberpadExternalEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing number pad enter on external keyboard.

variant.name: NumberpadExternalNonEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing number pad key other than enter on external keyboard.

variant.name: NumberpadInternalEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing enter on number pad on internal keyboard.

variant.name: NumberpadInternalNonEnterKeystrokes
variant.summary: Pressing number pad key other than enter on internal keyboard.

variant.name: SmartLock
variant.summary: Smart Lock

variant.name: StylusDetachedFromDockSession
variant.summary: Time spent from stylus being undocked, to being re-docked

variant.name: StylusDetachedFromGarageOrDockSession
variant.summary: Time spent while either out of garage or un-docked

variant.name: StylusDetachedFromGarageSession
variant.summary: Time spent from stylus being removed from garage, to being replaced into garage

variant.name: TabletLauncher
variant.summary: app launcher in tablet mode

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.ExternalProtocolDialog
histogram.summary: Records the response when the intent picker is shown to the user on Chrome OS to allow them to open an external protocol in an app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.ExternalProtocolDialog.Accepted
histogram.summary: Records the response when users that are shown the intent picker accept opening an external protocol in an app as well as whether the app is persisted.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.ExternalProtocolDialog.Rejected
histogram.summary: Records the response when users that are shown the intent picker reject opening an external protocol in an app.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.IntentPickerDestinationPlatform
histogram.summary: Records the app platform shown as the result of link intent handling. Recorded when the user makes a choice in the Intent Picker dialog, and when the result of a previous user preference is applied during a link click.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.NumberOfAppsForNotification
histogram.summary: Records whether a notification matches multiple apps, when there is one or multiple web apps matching a web page nonpersistent notification.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Apps.OpenBrowser
histogram.summary: Records the type of app sending a link to the browser to be opened.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Attestation.AttestationFlowStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of attestation flow. The value represents 6 flags in 6 rightmost bits; starting from more significant bits they mean: 1. Has proxy. 2. Is System proxy active. 3. Run the default flow. 4. The default flow succeeds. 5. Run the fallback flow. 6. The fallback flow succeeds.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Attestation.GetCertificateStatus
histogram.summary: Records the status of `AttesttionClient::GetCertificate()` called by `AttestationFlowIntegrated`.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.AutoFraming.AverageDetectionLatency
histogram.summary:
Records the average latency in running the detector during an Auto Framing enabled camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.
This metric is reported on ChromeOS devices with Auto Framing enabled.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.AutoFraming.DetectionHitRate
histogram.summary: Records the rate that the detector successfully detects a subject in the scene during an Auto Framing enabled camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.AutoFraming.EnabledCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that Auto Framing is toggled from off to on by the user during a camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.AutoFraming.EnabledTime
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of time that Auto Framing is turned on during a camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.AutoFraming.Error
histogram.summary: Records errors in Auto Framing that can break camera functionality or cause frame drops. Emitted at most once for each error when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.AutoFraming.MedianZoomRatio
histogram.summary: Records the median of sampled zoom ratios when Auto Framing zooms in camera frames to the subject during a camera session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.ConfigureStreams.Output.Resolution
histogram.summary: Records the resolution of output stream that is configured by Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.ConfigureStreamsLatency
histogram.summary:
Records the process time of ConfigureStreams() method in Chrome OS camera service.
This metric is reported for all users and will not cause abnormal distribution since the metric is Chrome OS specified.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.ErrorType
histogram.summary: Records the type of the error which triggers the Notify() method in Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.FaceAutoExposure.FunctionStatus
histogram.summary: Records face auto exposure function status of the Chrome OS device. The metric is reported when the camera is detected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.FaceAutoExposure.MaxNumDetectedFaces
histogram.summary: Records max number of detected faces of the camera session in Chrome OS camera service. The metric is reported when the camera is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.Facing
histogram.summary: Records the camera facing of the camera session in Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.GcamAutoExposure.AverageConvergenceLatency
histogram.summary: Records the average auto exposure convergence latency in frame count throughout a camera session that runs Gcam auto exposure. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.GcamAutoExposure.AverageHdrRatio
histogram.summary: Records the average HDR ratio throughout a camera session that runs Gcam auto exposure. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.GcamAutoExposure.AverageTet
histogram.summary: Records the average total exposure time (TET) throughout a camera session that runs Gcam auto exposure. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.AverageLatency.{ProcessingType}
histogram.summary:
Records the average CPU latency in running a given type of processing throughout a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.
This metric is reported on all ChromeOS devices with HDRnet enabled.

variant.name: Postprocessing
variant.summary: Post-processing of HDRnet RGB output to final YUV output(s)

variant.name: Preprocessing
variant.summary: Pre-processing of input YUV into linear RGB domain

variant.name: RgbPipeline
variant.summary: Main HDRnet inferencing and rendering

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.Error
histogram.summary: Records whether there's an error that can compromise the HDRnet feature, either causing frame drops or stops the pipeline from running completely, throughout a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.MaxOutputBuffersRendered
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of output buffers a HDRnet stream produces (greater than 1 means there are multiple streams with the same aspect ratio) throughtout a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.MaxStreamSize.{StreamType}
histogram.summary: Records the maximum size (in width * height pixels) of the HDRnet stream configured for a given output in a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

variant.name: BLOB
variant.summary: HDRnet stream for BLOB output

variant.name: YUV
variant.summary: HDRnet stream for YUV output

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.NumConcurrentStreams
histogram.summary: Records the number of concurrent HDRnet streams in a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.NumStillShotsTaken
histogram.summary: Records the number of HDRnet-rendered still capture shots taken in a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.HDRnet.StreamConfiguration
histogram.summary: Records the stream configuration including the number of streams, the type of streams, and if the streams are of the same aspect ratio in a HDRnet camera session. Emitted when the camera session is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.Jpeg.Latency
histogram.summary:
Records the process time of the JDA (Jpeg Decode Accelerator) or JEA (Jpeg Encode Accelerator) run on Chrome OS camera service. There are suffixes that record the runner method (hardware/software), the runner type (decode/encode).
This metric is reported for all users and will not cause abnormal distribution since the metric is Chrome OS specified.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.Jpeg.Resolution
histogram.summary: Records the resolution of the image that JDA/JEA process by Chrome OS camera service. The resolution represents by the total pixels contained in the image. There are suffixes that record the runner method (hardware/software), the runner type (decode/encode).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.OpenDeviceClientType
histogram.summary: Records which client type (e.g., Chrome, Android) is opening a camera device.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.OpenDeviceLatency
histogram.summary:
Records the process time of OpenDevice() method in Chrome OS camera service.
This metric is reported for all users and will not cause abnormal distribution since the metric is Chrome OS specified.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Camera.SessionDuration
histogram.summary: Records the session duration in Chrome OS camera service.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.CsrSignTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took the certificate provisioning worker to sign a CSR. Emitted after the sign is complete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.Event
histogram.summary: Number of times each event is reached during the certificate provisioning flow.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.KeypairGenerationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took the certificate provisioning worker to generate one key pair. Emitted after the generation is complete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.Result
histogram.summary: For final states (see the list in cert_provisioning::IsFinalState): number of times the certificate provisioning worker finished on every state. For other states: number of times the worker failed on every state.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CertProvisioning.VaTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took the certificate provisioning worker to build one Verified Access response. Emitted after the response is built.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.CollectPerf
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to collecting and processing profile data obtained via "perf events" on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.CollectProcessTypes
histogram.summary: Record the collection status (success or failure) when the Chrome process and thread types are collected as part of the ChromeOS perf profile collection.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.JankinessTriggerStatus
histogram.summary:
Records the status of collection attempts triggered by jankiness on Chrome OS.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 08/30/2020 to 03/30/2022; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.ParseCPUFrequencies
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to the parsing of logical CPU frequencies on Chrome OS. Recorded when the browser process starts.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.ParseLacrosPath
histogram.summary: A count of various locations gotten from parsing a Lacros binary path. This is used to monitor any change to the Lacros path. Recorded when a Lacros binary path was found when CWP collects browser processes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.ParsePSICPU
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to the parsing of PSI CPU data on Chrome OS. Recorded after each perf collection.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.ParsePSIMemory
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to the parsing of PSI Memory data on Chrome OS. Recorded after each perf collection.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.PSIMemPressure.{PType}
histogram.summary: Reports periodic memory pressure metrics, as seen ChromeOS-wide. Metrics originally come from /proc/pressure/memory readings, expressed as a percentage with 2 decimal points (99.99%), but expressed as p*100, in an integer in the range (1-9999) meaning (00.01% to 99.99%). Underflow value 0 means "no pressure" - 0%.

variant.name: ArcFull
variant.summary: Percentage of time ARC was fully halted waiting on memory

variant.name: ArcSome
variant.summary: Percentage of ARC had some blocking on memory

variant.name: Full
variant.summary: Percentage of time fully halted waiting on memory operations

variant.name: Some
variant.summary: Percentage of time when there was some blocking on memory

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.RecordPerf
histogram.summary: A count of the various outcomes related to recording the profile data collected via "perf events" on Chrome OS. The histogram is recorded when system-wide CPU profiling finishes and the collected data is being saved to memory for later upload.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.CWP.UploadPerf
histogram.summary: Records the number of "perf events" reports included in an UMA upload on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Debugd.Perf.GetBigFeedbackLogs.{SubTaskName}
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for each sub task of LogTool::GetBigFeedbackLogs to complete. Recording happens on each call to debugd's GetBigFeedbackLogs.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Debugd.Perf.{FunctionName}
histogram.summary: Records the total time it takes for each call to LogTool::{FunctionName} to complete. Recording happens on each D-Bus call to debugd.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DeviceSettings.FeatureFlagsMigration
histogram.summary: Migration status for Chrome OS feature flags configuration in device settings. This is intended to track migration progress in the field, so the migration code can be removed when the old approach of storing bare flags is no longer relevant in the field.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.Error.CrosHealthdProbeError.{ProbeErrorSourceStruct}
histogram.summary: Records the ProbeError::ErrorType returned on request for {ProbeErrorSourceStruct}. Recorded on the event a request to cros_healthd probe service returns a ProbeError.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.Error.{ErrorSource}
histogram.summary: Records error type such as no data error, not a number error and expectation not met error when receiving system information including battery info, network info and system info. All errors are recorded.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.InitialScreen
histogram.summary: Records requested initial screen when opening the Diagnostics App.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.MemoryRoutineDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the Memory Routine took to complete. Emitted when the routine completes successfully.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.OpenDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the Diagnostics App is open. emitted when the app is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.RoutineCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of routines run while the Chrome OS Diagnostics App was open. Begins at zero each time the app is open and recorded each time the app is closed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.{NavigationView}.OpenDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the Diagnostics App is open for a given page view. Emitted when the active page changes or when the app is closed. Cumulatively adds up to the total duration recorded by "ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.OpenDuration" or "ChromeOS.FeatureUsage.DiagnosticsUi.Usetime".

variant.name: System
variant.summary: chrome://diagnostics/?system or chrome://diagnostics

histogram.name: ChromeOS.DiagnosticsUi.{RoutineType}Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the {RoutineType} Routine.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FeatureUsage.{FeatureName}
histogram.summary: Records device eligibility, enabled status, and success rate for the {FeatureName} feature. Different events are recorded at different times, as described in the enum labels.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FeatureUsage.{FeatureName}.Usetime
histogram.summary: Records the duration of time (ms) a given {FeatureName} feature was used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FirmwareUpdateUi.InstallResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of installing a firmware update. Recorded once per install and the histogram is emitted either when an install is completed or when a failure state is reached. An example failure state is if we're unable to create a firmware update directory.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FirmwareUpdateUi.{Source}.DeviceCount
histogram.summary: Records the total number of devices found. OnStartup is recorded when a user first logs in and OnRefresh is recorded for any subsequent request. The cases in which a subsequent request will be made are when the Firmware Update SWA is launched, when an install is completed, and when we detect that a device has been added or removed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.FirmwareUpdateUi.{Source}.{Severity}UpdateCount
histogram.summary: Records the total number of {Severity} firmware updates found for all of the peripherals currently connected. The histogram is emitted once we've received the list of updates (if any) for all peripherals. OnStartup is recorded when a user first logs in and OnRefresh is recorded for any subsequent request. The cases in which a subsequent request will be made are when the Firmware Update SWA is launched, when an install is completed, and when we detect that a device has been added or removed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Gaia.Done.ElapsedTime
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent by user to complete GAIA login. Recorded during user sign-in when Chrome received all the signals from Gaia.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Gaia.Message.{GaiaAuthFlow}.{MessageName}
ChromeOS.Gaia.PasswordFlow
histogram.summary: Records events for the Gaia password flow. "Started" is recorded on each password entry on the Gaia page. "Completed" is recorded when Gaia authentication succeeds. Note: this is not recorded for SAML flows.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.Report
histogram.summary: Qualification status of each component types. This entry is generated by hardware_verifier.conf at boot time.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.Report.IsCompliant
histogram.summary: Aggregated result of hardware verifier check.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.TimeToFinish
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to finish one hardware verification run.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HardwareVerifier.TimeToProbe
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to probe hardware components.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.HaTS.{Survey}
histogram.summary: Records the responses for HaTS questions, to be analyzed against other OS metrics like performance or number of crashes. Emitted during the lifecycle of a survey and when a user answers any question on a HaTS survey.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorClientConcurrent
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of concurrent sensor clients within an hour, which indicates how many apps are using sensors. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorObserver
histogram.summary: Records the maximum number of running observers within an hour to any sensor. It indicates how widely used the sensor samples are. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorObserverOpen
histogram.summary: Records the number of opened observer within an hour, which indicates how often sensors are enabled and disabled. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IioService.SensorUsage.{Frequency}Hz
histogram.summary: Records the usage of the sensor within an hour with at least {Frequency} Hz. Recorded once every hour. Might not be recorded for tail-end usage during a session.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.IntentPickerAction
histogram.summary: The intent picker dialog is shown (either automatically, or though a page action button) when the user navigates to a page whose URL can be handled by an installed app. This metric is recorded when the dialog is closed and records the user action which caused it to close.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.IntentPickerAction.From{LaunchSource}
histogram.summary: The intent picker dialog is shown when the user navigates to a page whose URL can be handled by an installed app. This metric is recorded when the dialog is closed and records the user action which caused it to close. Only recorded when the Intent Picker dialog is shown from {LaunchSource}.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.IntentPickerIconEvent
histogram.summary: Records events associated with the intent picker icon in the omnibox. Recorded when the icon is shown or interacted with.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.LinkCapturingEvent
histogram.summary: Records when the link capturing entry point is shown, when a link is successfully captured and results in opening an app, and when the user changes their settings to automatically capture similar links in the future.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.LinkCapturingEvent.{AppType}App
histogram.summary: Records when the link capturing entry point is shown for the {AppType} app type, when a link is successfully captured and results in opening a/ an {AppType} app, and when the user changes their settings to automatically capture similar links in the future.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.LinkCapturingEvent2
histogram.summary:
Records when the link capturing entry point is shown, when a link is successfully captured and results in opening an app, and when the user changes their settings to automatically capture similar links in the future.
Replaces ChromeOS.Intents.LinkCapturingEvent, which incorrectly recorded events when the user changed settings to stay in Chrome.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Intents.LinkCapturingEvent2.{AppType}App
histogram.summary:
Records when the link capturing entry point is shown for the {AppType} app type, when a link is successfully captured and results in opening a/ an {AppType} app, and when the user changes their settings to automatically capture similar links in the future.
Replaces ChromeOS.Intents.LinkCapturingEvent.{AppType}App, which incorrectly recorded events when the user changed settings to stay in Chrome.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.IsLacrosBrowser
histogram.summary: Recorded as part of the metrics session data to identify the lacros-chrome browser binary.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.ArcUsageUpdate
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the arc usage flags update started as well as the number of times it succeeded and failed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.ArcUsageUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to successfully update chaps with the new ARC usage flags.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.Migration
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the migration started as well as the number of times it succeeded and failed. It also counts the number of necessary migrations. Necessary migrations are the ones that work on migrating permissions for at least one key. Currently, some migration processes start when there are 0 keys saved in preferences.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.KeyPermissionsManager.MigrationTime
histogram.summary: Records the time taken to successfully migrate key permissions to chaps.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Lacros.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Time to load Lacros binary. The bulk of load time may be spent in mounting Lacros browser binary through squashfs in the component manager. If the user has explicitly specified a path for the Lacros browser binary though, load time will very likely be insignificant. Recorded by ash each time the lacros binary is started.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Lacros.OSChannel
histogram.summary: The release channel of the Chrome OS system on which Lacros is running. May be different than the Lacros browser release channel. Recorded by the lacros binary shortly after startup.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Lacros.StartTime
histogram.summary: Time to start the lacros binary, specifically the time between when the process is launched and the mojo connection is established between ash and lacros. Recorded by ash each time the lacros binary is started.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.GetPackState.FeatureId
histogram.summary: Records which feature requested a Pack from Language Packs Manager; specifically an entry is recorded each time GetPackState is called.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.GetPackState.LanguageCode
histogram.summary: Records which language was requested from Language Packs Manager; specifically an entry is recorded each time GetPackState is called.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.InstallComplete.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether a language pack installation was successful after a language pack installation attempt.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.Mojo.BasePackStateResponse
histogram.summary: Records the state of what state a base pack is in (whether it's installed or not) when the language packs Mojo interface responds to an IPC.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.Mojo.GetPackInfo.Feature
histogram.summary: Records which feature was requested by callers of the language packs Mojo interface's "GetPackInfo" IPC call.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.Mojo.InstallBasePack.Feature
histogram.summary: Records which feature was requested by callers of the language packs Mojo interface's "InstallBasePack" IPC call.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.Mojo.InstallPack.Feature
histogram.summary: Records which feature was requested by callers of the language packs Mojo interface's "InstallPack" IPC call.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.Mojo.PackStateResponse
histogram.summary: Records the state of what state a language pack is in (whether it's installed or not) when the language packs Mojo interface responds to an IPC.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.LanguagePacks.UninstallComplete.Success
histogram.summary: Records whether a language pack uninstallation was successful after a language pack uninstallation attempt.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Liveness.BrowserStateAtTimeout
histogram.summary: Records the state of the Chrome browser process at the moment session_manager's LivenessChecker ping times out. This is the moment when LivenessChecker will send an abort signal, if sending an abort signal is enabled, but this metric is recorded regardless of whether or not aborting from LivenessChecker is enabled. Exactly one sample of this metric is recorded when the timeout occurs. If aborting is enabled, this should mean one sample per abort.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Liveness.PingResponseTime
histogram.summary: Reports the time (ms) elapsed between sending of a LivenessChecker ping and receipt of the response. Recorded when LivenessChecker receives a ping response.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Liveness.PingResult
histogram.summary: Records whether the dbus liveness pings successfully go through. True is recorded when the session manager daemon receives the pong back from chrome in time. False is recorded when it times out waiting for the pong.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}EntryCountPerDay
histogram.summary: Metrics of the numbers of log entries recorded in {LogType}s. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}LogFileSizePerDay
histogram.summary: File sizes of {LogType} files in megabytes. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}MaxThroughputPerMin
histogram.summary: Metrics of the number of maximum throughput (entries per minute) recorded in {LogType}s within a day. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Logging.{LogType}TotalFileSize
histogram.summary: Total file sizes of {LogType} files in megabytes. Recorded when the daily job "chromeos-cleanup-logs" is executed.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.AgeSeconds
histogram.summary:
The number of seconds of uptime since the last time the Chrome OS machine-id was regenerated. This is reported every time the machine-id is regenerated except for the first time since reboot.
NB: Data before M90 is incomplete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.Lock
histogram.summary: Measures whether the MachineIdRegen script acquires the lock. Success / Fail is recorded every time the script is invoked. This is to test if the locking is working as expected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MachineIdRegen.Reason
histogram.summary:
The reason why the Chrome OS machine-id was regenerated. This is reported when the machine-id is re-generated.
NB: Data before M90 is incomplete.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MemoryPressureLevel
histogram.summary: The memory pressure level in Chrome OS, which is recorded periodically (once per second). This is used to show the relative frequency of the system being in a critical vs relaxed memory pressure state.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.MessageCenter.ScrollActionReason
histogram.summary: The cause of the scroll event by the user on the message center. Only the first event after the message center opens is recorded. For example, the user opens the message center and scrolls by mouse then by key, only the mouse event is recorded. If the user closes and reopens the message center before the second event, both events are recorded.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Available
histogram.summary: Whether platform verification subsystem features are available at the time a platform verification request is made for content protection on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.BrowserResult
histogram.summary: The result of a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS, limited to the browser-specific checks. It's still possible for platform verification to fail at later layers.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.Result2
histogram.summary: The result of a platform verification attempt for content protection on Chrome OS. Does not include browser-related failures. Those are tracked in ChromeOS.PlatformVerification.BrowserResult.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PrivacyHub.Opened
histogram.summary: Records when the user visits the Privacy Hub page in system settings. Capturing the origin where the user navigated from.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PrivacyHub.{FeatureName}.{Source}.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records when the user changes the device-wide {FeatureName} access from the {Source}. This can happen directly from the settings page "Settings">"Security and Privacy">"Privacy hub" or through notifications.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.PrivacyScreen.Toggled
histogram.summary: Record when the user toggles the integrated privacy screen on/off. See the PrivacyScreenToggleUISurface enum for all UI surfaces for toggling the feature.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.RgbKeyboard.RgbKeyboardCapabilityType
histogram.summary: Records whether or not RGB keyboard is supported for the current device. Most devices will return RgbKeyboardCapabilityType::None since RGB keyboard is currently only supported on a handful of devices. We still include these samples since it'll be useful for finding real failures, i.e, RgbKeyboardCapabilityType::None is recorded for a device that supports RGB.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.RgbKeyboard.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records the source of RGB backlight change for a device.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.APILogin
histogram.summary: Records every online login authenticated purely with GAIA or with SAML.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.InSessionPasswordChangeEvent
histogram.summary: Records how often users are guided through the SAML in-session password change flow, and how often it is completed succesfully.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.InSessionPasswordSyncEvent
histogram.summary: Records how often password sync token API is called. Tracks results of token verify operation and API errors.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Provider
histogram.summary: Records SAML provider when SAML login flow is used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Scraping.PasswordCountAll
histogram.summary: The number of passwords that were scraped during a Chrome OS login via SAML. This is set only when the Chrome Credentials Passing API is not used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SAML.Scraping.VerificationResult
histogram.summary: Whether one of the scraped passwords was successfully verified as the user's password. This is set only when the Chrome Credentials Passing API is not used.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SecurityAnomaly
histogram.summary:
Records when an event representing a deviation from the Chrome OS security posture happens.
Writable+executable mount events are checked every thirty seconds, but each anomalous event is reported only once per boot.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SecurityAnomalyUploadSuccess
histogram.summary:
Records the result (boolean success or failure) of attempting to report a Chrome OS system as anomalous via the crash reporting service.
Reporting is only attempted if one or more anomalies are detected (see the previous histogram's description for the types of anomalies considered), *and* once per boot, even if reporting fails.
So this histogram will be recorded at most once per boot, and only if a system is detected as anomalous (i.e. presents any of the tracked anomalies.)

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.AppCount2.{AppType}
histogram.summary:
Records number of {AppType} apps found for a given intent in the Sharesheet when the sharesheet is invoked. Has 100 exponential buckets. (The original histogram had 1000 linear buckets).
Warning: this histogram was expired from M95 to M96; data may be missing.

variant.name: All
variant.summary: all apps

variant.name: Arc
variant.summary: arc app

variant.name: Web
variant.summary: web app

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.CopyToClipboard.FormFactor
histogram.summary: Records the form factor when the Copy To Clipboard option is selected from the sharesheet.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.FileCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of files a user is trying to share from the Sharesheet when the sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.FormFactor
histogram.summary: Records the form factor when the Sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.IsDriveFolder
histogram.summary: If the value is true, the data being shared from the Sharesheet is a folder from Drive. Recorded when the sharesheet is invoked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.IsImagePreviewPressed
histogram.summary: If the value is true, the image preview was pressed during the current invocation. Recorded when the sharesheet closes.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.LaunchSource
histogram.summary:
Records the source from which the Sharesheet is invoked.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M95 to M96; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.ShareActionCount
histogram.summary:
Records each action found for a given intent when the Sharesheet is invoked.
Warning: this histogram was expired from M95 to M96; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.UserAction
histogram.summary: Records user action on sharesheet invocations.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sharesheet.{Location}.MimeType
histogram.summary:
Records the mime type of the content being copied at the {Location} point in the Sharesheet flow.
This histogram could record multiple times in a single share in the event that the user shares data of mime types at once. However, a single share will not record the same mime type twice. E.g. sharing 2 images in one share will record the image mimetype once.

variant.name: CopyToClipboard
variant.summary: After copy to clipboard is selected

variant.name: Invocation
variant.summary: When the sharesheet is first invoked

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Sync.PreferencesMigrated
histogram.summary: Tracks whether browser sync preferences were migrated to the new OS sync feature (project SplitSettingsSync). Recorded once per session during login.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the collapse / expand animation of the system tray.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.BlockedNotifiersAfterUpdate
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of blocked notifiers in the system tray after the user blocks one or multiple notifiers. Note that this metric records the number of blocked notifiers *after* the update.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.BlockedNotifiersOnOpen
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of blocked notifiers in the system tray when it is opened.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.FirstInteraction
histogram.summary: Records the first interaction the user has with the system tray, which can be a click/tap on the quick settings or message center bubble. Note that this interaction could be at any time after the user opens the tray (e.g. 30 seconds later before the first click).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Interaction
histogram.summary: An enum value how system tray bubble is interacted e.g. by tap (touch screen), or click (mouse, trackpad, etc.) Reported every time the region inside system tray bubble is tapped or clicked.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.IsExpandedOnOpen
histogram.summary: If the value is true, SystemTray is expanded when it's opened. Otherwise, it's closed when it's opened.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Network.RowClickedAction
histogram.summary: This metric will record each action taken as a result of a user clicking a Network from Network list within system tray. Metric emitted each time a user clicks on a network list row.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Network.SectionShown
histogram.summary: Records when different sections within the detailed network view in the system tray shown. This metric is emitted each time a user opens the system tray and each time a different network section is newly shown.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Network.{NetworkType}.Toggled
histogram.summary: Records the new value of the WiFi/Mobile toggle button in system tray. Metric emitted each time a user clicks on the enable/disable WiFi or Mobile toggle.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.NotificationsRemovedByClearAll
histogram.summary: Records the number of notifications that are removed in a single clear all action by the user.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.OpenHelpPageForManaged
histogram.summary: Type of the support page which user opened by clicking the indicator of managed device type in the unified system tray bubble.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.ShelfPodCount
histogram.summary: The number of status area item pods (e.g. IME, Palette, Dictation, etc.) in the shelf status area whenever a pod appears/disappears. This histogram is only logged when the device is not in tablet mode, otherwise ChromeOS.SystemTray.Tablet.ShelfPodCount is logged.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.Tablet.ShelfPodCount
histogram.summary: The number of status area item pods (e.g. IME, Palette, Dictation, etc.) in the shelf status area whenever a pod appears/disappears. This histogram is only logged when the device is in tablet mode, otherwise ChromeOS.SystemTray.ShelfPodCount is logged.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.TimeToClick
histogram.summary: The amount of time a user took from clicking on the button in status area, to clicking on an item in the system tray bubble. (Obsolete M90 onwards).

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.TimeToClick2
histogram.summary: The amount of time a user took after opening the system tray bubble, to clicking on an item in the system tray bubble.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.SystemTray.ToggleExpanded
histogram.summary: An enum value how system tray bubble is expanded or collapsed. It can be toggled by the button and touch gesture.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.CableSpeed
histogram.summary: This value represents the speed of the USB Type-C cable which is connected to a device. It is recorded every time a new peripheral is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.PartnerType
histogram.summary: This value represents the type of a USB Type-C peripheral (the Partner) which is connected to a device. It is recorded every time a new peripheral is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.UsbDeviceSpeed
histogram.summary: This value represents the speed (USB standard) of USB device connected. It is recorded every time a new USB device is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.TypeC.WrongConfiguration
histogram.summary: This value represents events where a USB Type-C peripheral couldn't be configured correctly, or experienced some other unexpected behaviour. It is recorded every time a new peripheral is connected.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.UrlXattrsCount
histogram.summary: The number of files with URL extended attributes found in the users' home directories. This is emitted once per boot. See crbug.com/919486 and crbug.com/939386 for more details.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.USB.DeviceAttached
histogram.summary: Timing and number of USB devices attached.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.USB.ExternalDeviceAttached.{USBDeviceRecognized}.{USBDeviceClass}
histogram.summary: Timing and number of external USB devices attached. This is emitted each time an external device is attached via USB and when user logs in with an external device attached.

variant.name: Recognized
variant.summary: A device that was already added to the list of trusted devices

variant.name: Unrecognized
variant.summary: A device that was not in the list of trusted devices yet

variant.name: App
variant.summary: A device with only the application specific interface class

variant.name: Audio
variant.summary: An audio device

variant.name: AV
variant.summary: An audio/video device

variant.name: Card
variant.summary: A smart card reader

variant.name: Comm
variant.summary: A communication device

variant.name: Health
variant.summary: A personal healthcare device

variant.name: HID
variant.summary: A human-interface device

variant.name: Hub
variant.summary: A USB hub

variant.name: Image
variant.summary: A still image capture device

variant.name: Misc
variant.summary: A device with only the misc. interface class

variant.name: Other
variant.summary: All devices not covered by the other groups

variant.name: Phys
variant.summary: A physical device

variant.name: Print
variant.summary: A printer

variant.name: Sec
variant.summary: A security device (e.g. fingerprint reader)

variant.name: Storage
variant.summary: A storage device

variant.name: Vendor
variant.summary: A device with only the vendor specific interface class

variant.name: Video
variant.summary: A video device

variant.name: Wireless
variant.summary: A wireless controller device

histogram.name: ChromeOS.USB.ExternalDeviceAttached.{USBPortType}.DeviceClass
histogram.summary: USB device class per {USBPortType}. This is emitted each time an external device is attached via USB and when user logs in with an external device attached.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.USB.ExternalDeviceAttached.{USBPortType}.DeviceSpeed
histogram.summary: USB device speed per {USBPortType}. This is emitted each time an external device is attached via USB and when user logs in with an external device attached.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.UserTypeByDeviceType.LogSegment
histogram.summary: This value is reported at the start of a user session, and is a 32-bit value that reports the primary user account type and the device type (umanaged user on managed device, K12 user on an education device, etc.). The upper 16-bits represent the device type (found at http://shortn/_3iFWcdjy0P), and the lower 16-bits represent the user type (found at http://shortn/_uK3ZM4pC0a). So a nonprofit user (0x03) on an enterprise device (0x02) would be 0x00020003 or 131075.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WebAPK.{InstallType}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the overall final state of a WebAPK {InstallType} operation on ChromeOS. A WebAPK is generated and installed when a PWA which supports Web Share Target is installed in the browser, and updated when the PWA's manifest updates.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.WXMountCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of writable+executable mounts on the system. The count itself is updated every 30 seconds, but this metric is reported every two hours of runtime. This metric is reported regardless of whether users are logged in or not. This metric is only reported on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Zram.{CountMetric}
histogram.summary: Records {CountMetric}. Recorded every 10s from boot to shutdown.

variant.name: BdCount
variant.summary: the number of blocks currently written on the backing device

variant.name: BdReads
variant.summary: the number of block reads from backing device

variant.name: BdWrites
variant.summary: the number of block writes to backing device

variant.name: FailedReads
variant.summary: the number of failed reads in zram

variant.name: FailedWrites
variant.summary: the number of failed writes in zram

variant.name: HugePages
variant.summary: the number of incompressible pages

variant.name: HugePagesSince
variant.summary: number of huge pages since zram set up

variant.name: InvalidIo
variant.summary: number of non-page-size-aligned I/O requests in zram

variant.name: NotifyFree
variant.summary: depending on device usage scenario it may account a) the number of pages freed because of swap slot free notifications or b) the number of pages freed because of REQ_OP_DISCARD requests sent by bio

variant.name: PagesCompacted
variant.summary: the number of pages freed during compaction

variant.name: SamePages
variant.summary: the number of same element filled pages written to this disk

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Zram.{HugePageActivityMetric}
histogram.summary: Records the {HugePageActivityMetric} in a period of time. Recorded every 10s from boot to shutdown. Period is the time between recordings (10s).

variant.name: HugePagesRemoved
variant.summary: number of incompressible(huge) pages removed

variant.name: HugePagesStored
variant.summary: number of incompressible(huge) pages added

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Zram.{PctMetric}
histogram.summary: Records {PctMetric}. Recorded every 10s from boot to shutdown.

variant.name: CompressedSizePct
variant.summary: the overall compression ratio of data store in zram disk

variant.name: HugePagesPct
variant.summary: the percentage of incompressible pages in zram

variant.name: SamePagesPct
variant.summary: the percentage of stored pages which are same pages, these pages have only repeated content

histogram.name: ChromeOS.Zram.{SizeMetric}
histogram.summary: Records {SizeMetric}. Recorded every 10s from boot to shutdown.

variant.name: ComprDataSizeMB
variant.summary: the compressed size of data stored in zram disk

variant.name: MemLimitMB
variant.summary: the maximum amount of memory zram can use to store The compressed data

variant.name: MemUsedMaxMB
variant.summary: the peak memory that has zram used

variant.name: MemUsedTotalMB
variant.summary: the total amount of memory in use for a zram disk

variant.name: OrigDataSizeMB
variant.summary: the uncompressed size of data stored in zram disk
